entries: Each creature within a 10 ft. cone in front of Dilophosaurus must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success they take half as much damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Subsurface Monster
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can hold its breath for up to 10 hours and has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while submerged in water.
If Wretchglow, the Last Light is hidden, as a bonus action it can create an illusionary lure, following the same rules as its Bioluminescent Lure legendary action.

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light can opt to emit a dull glow of any colour, creating dim light for 40 ft. around it. It can activate/deactivate this light at will at any point but, while active, it cannot hide.

trait.name: Oscillating Thermoregulation
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light has resistance to fire and cold damage (included above).

trait.name: Intelligent
entries: Wretchglow, the Last Light is capable of planning in combat and is able to utilise its environment to help defeat foes (i.e., drowning foes or causing cave collapses).

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water, Wretchglow, the Last Light has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

action.name: Bioluminescent Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, Wretchglow, the Last Light can unleash a huge flash of light.
Each other creature within 40 ft. that can see it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for two rounds.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Wretchglow, the Last Light chooses the attack action, it can make one Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d6 + 11}) piercing damage.
A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}).
While a creature is {@condition grappled} by this attack, Wretchglow, the Last Light cannot attack another target with its Colossal Needle-Toothed Jaws attack.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +11, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d8 + 11}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Wretchglow, the Last Light (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Misdirecting Strobe. Each creature within 40 ft. of Wretchglow, the Last Light that can see it must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.
If they roll a natural 1 on the Dexterity saving throw, they are instead {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Direct Currents. So long as Wretchglow, the Last Light is submerged in water, it may pick up to 4 creatures within 60 ft. who are also submerged in connected water and move them up to 10 ft. in any direction, so long as they remain submerged in water.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Bioluminescent Lure. Wretchglow, the Last Light creates a visual illusion up to 10ft. in size that must be within 30 ft. of itself. The illusion ends if Wretchglow, the Last Light moves more than 30 ft. away from it, if it uses this legendary action again, or if it chooses to dismiss the illusion.
Any other creature that sees the illusion must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or perceive the illusion as real (and generally be drawn to it).
On its turn, a creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful {@dc 16} {@skill Investigation} check

trait.name: Reactionary Crystalline Regulation
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror may use its reaction to gain immunity to fire, cold, lightning, thunder, acid, poison, radiant, necrotic, psychic, or force damage until its next turn. The crystals on its body visibly flicker/crackle/bubble with energies of the associated damage type.
This immunity is in addition to any gained by its Elemental Absorb legendary action.

trait.name: Surging Power
entries: At the start of Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror's turn, select one of the following effects:
1. It may make an additional Hooked Claw attack this turn.
2. It may dash as a bonus action this turn.
3. Each creature within 10 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} lightning damage.
It has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Semi-Aquatic
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rostral Dermal Pressure Sensors
entries: While in water (or lava), Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has a blindsight of 10 ft. (included above).

trait.name: Crystalline Form
entries: Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror is immune to any effect that would charm or petrify it (included above).

action.name: Unleash Energies {@recharge 5}
entries: Crackling magical energies erupt from Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror. Each other creature within 40 ft. must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage and {@damage 6d6} force damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror chooses the attack action, it may make one Shardmaw Bite attack and one Hooked Claw attack.

action.name: Shardmaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +12, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d6 + 12}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

action.name: Hooked Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +12, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d8 + 12}) slashing damage.
A creature hit by this attack can be moved up to 5 ft. in any direction by Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror (no save allowed).

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Shard Breath (Recharge 3-6). Ranged Weapon Attack: +6, range 10 ft. cone, up to four targets {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Elemental Absorb. Until its next turn, Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror gains immunity to one damage type from the list below, however if it has already gained an immunity from this ability, it instead replaces it. Its crystals change colour to the associated colour.
Fire (red)
Cold (blue)
Lightning (yellow)
4. Poison (green) This immunity is in addition to any gained from its Reactionary Crystalline Regulation ability.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Prismatic Glow. Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror produces a bright light, illuminating an area of up to 60 ft. with bright white light and a further 60 ft. with dim light (total 120 ft.). Each other creature within 10 ft. of it takes {@damage 1d10} radiant damage (no save allowed).
If Xu'thul, the Prismatic Terror has used Elemental Absorb this turn, the light is that associated colour instead.

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Villager has an additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a  creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Villager, it takes {@damage 1d4 - 1} piercing damage (minimum of 1).

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Villager only requires 4 hours of sleep per day.

items: {@skill Performance}
{@skill Persuasion}
{@skill Religion}

trait.name: Community Member
entries: Select one skill from the list below, this Pluvenn Villager gains a +3 bonus to any checks for that skill. Alternatively, you can select any tool (excluding Forgery Kit, Poisoner's Kit, and Thieves' Tools) and this  Pluvenn Villager instead gains proficiency with that tool and an additional +2 bonus to any checks with it.

items: {@skill Animal Handling}
{@skill History}
{@skill Medicine}
{@skill Nature} This Pluvenn Villager should be appropriately dressed to  match their community contribution/role.

action.name: Razormaw Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pluvenn Flowertender's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks).
It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Rose Picker
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has resistance to  non-magical piercing damage (included above).

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender has an  additional +3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Flowertender, it takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

trait.name: Nocturnal/Diurnal
entries: Pluvenn Flowertender only requires 4 hours of sleep per day

action.name: Weed-Pulling Razormaw
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage

monster.name: Pluvenn Huntleader
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other language)

trait.name: Pinning Grapple
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader has an additional
+3 bonus to Strength checks when attempting to grapple a  creature. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by Pluvenn Huntleader, it takes {@damage 1d4 + 3} piercing damage.

trait.name: Master of the Hunt
entries: Pluvenn Huntleader only requires 4 hours of sleep per day, unless pursuing a marked target, in which case it only requires 2 hours of sleep per day.
Pluvenn Huntleader also has advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks for climbing.

trait.name: Endure Pain
entries: When hit by an attack, Pluvenn Huntleader can use its reaction to give itself resistance to either non?magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Mark Target
entries: As a bonus action, Pluvenn Huntleader can apply a magical mark to a target that it can see within 60 ft. The mark is a blood-red, dully-glowing symbol.

The mark can only be removed via magical means (i.e. {@spell Dispel Magic} or a similar effect), if the marked creature dies, or if Pluvenn Huntleader dies. Alternatively, Pluvenn Huntleader may dismiss the mark at will.
Pluvenn Huntleader has advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to  pursue a marked target and its attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage (of the same damage type) to the target.
Only one mark per Pluvenn Huntleader may be active at  a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Pluvenn Huntleader chooses the attack action, it may make any combination of three attacks with any of the  weapons listed below.

action.name: Exquisite Longsword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 ({@dice 1d8 + 6}) magical slashing damage.

action.name: Wrist Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} +9, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Grappling Hook
entries: {@atk rw} +9, range 40 ft., one target. {@h}2 (2) piercing damage.

A creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Only one creature may be {@condition grappled} by this attack at a time. Pluvenn Huntleader does not gain the benefits of "Pinning Grapple" when grappling with this attack.
Pluvenn Huntleader can only end the grapple from this  attack as a bonus action.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Broker
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

trait.name: Flush Crest (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Broker can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Broker with a  melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Broker may use its  reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of  Guild Broker's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by

trait.name: Guild Broker
entries: Additionally, Guild Broker knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Shrewd Negotiator
entries: Guild Broker has advantage on  {@skill Persuasion} checks and is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition (included above).

trait.name: Hip-Shooter
entries: An enemy being within 5 ft. of Guild Broker does not cause it to have disadvantage when making a  ranged attack with its Concealed Hand Crossbow. Guild Broker's Concealed Hand Crossbow is hidden until fired.

action.name: Broke Peace
entries: As an action, Guild Broker can call for a truce. Each enemy that can hear Guild Broker and  understands at least one of the languages that Guild Broker speaks must succeed a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or consider Guild Broker to no longer be an enemy and may not attack Guild Broker (or any member of Guild Broker's guild), unless it or one of its guild Members attacks first or otherwise breaks the peace. A creature that  is particularly hostile to Guild Broker makes its Charisma saving throw at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Guild Broker chooses the attack action, it may make two Concealed Hand Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Concealed Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} +3, range 30/120, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. If the first attack made by Guild Broker in combat is with  this weapon, the attack is made at advantage and deals an  additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +4, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

monster.name: Manyhorn Guild Elder
languages: any three (usually Common, Archosauric, and one other)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Manyhorn Guild Elder's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Flush Crest (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Elder with a  melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Elder may use its  reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of Guild Elder's guild for at least 24 hours is also known

trait.name: by Guild Elder
entries: Additionally, Guild Elder knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

trait.name: Guild Master
entries: Any non-Guild Elder member of Guild Elder's guild will defend Guild Elder with their lives.

action.name: Guild Command
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Elder can command any other non-Guild Elder member of its guild who can hear it. That creature may immediately move up to its maximum walking speed and take an action.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ceremonial Guild Sword (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) magical piercing damage.

trait.name: Flush Crest (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Guild Initiate can flush its head crest with blood, giving itself advantage on  Charisma checks for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Horned Repose
entries: If a creature fails to hit Guild Initiate with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it, Guild Initiate may use its reaction to make a Horn Skewer attack back at  that creature.

trait.name: Guild Knowledge
entries: Any party member known by a member of  Guild Initiate's guild for at least 24 hours is also known by

trait.name: Guild Initiate
entries: Additionally, Guild Initiate knows any details that other members of its guild have learnt about them.

action.name: Guild Mace
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Jeholrak Politician
languages: any four (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

trait.name: Demagogue
entries: In addition to other spells, once per day, the Jeholrak Politician may cast {@spell Mass Suggestion} (at 6th level, with a spell save DC of 13) without material components. Player characters are unaffected by this spell unless they are currently {@condition charmed} by Jeholrak Politician.

trait.name: Pheromonal Influence
entries: Jeholrak Politician may cast the  following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (with a spell save DC of 13):
2/day: Charm Person, Animal Friendship
1/day: Suggestion (also see Demagogue) Jeholrak Politician may cast these spells without components. The only indication that anything is happening is a slightly sweet smell in the air.

trait.name: Practiced Charismatic Speaker
entries: Jeholrak Politician has advantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Feeble Strike
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Command Defend
entries: As an action, Jeholrak Politician may select a friendly non-Jeholrak Politician creature within 30 ft. of it. That creature may move up to its maximum walking speed and take an action.

trait.name: Various Equipment
entries: Jeholrak Defender may be equipped with one of the three options below. They may only use the  attack associated with each equipment set:

trait.name: - Sleek Short Sword and Shield (also increase AC by 2)
entries: - Two-handed Glaive.
- Medium Crossbow.

trait.name: Calming Pheromones (1/Day)
entries: Jeholrak Defender may cast {@spell Animal Friendship} with a spell save DC of 11.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Jeholrak Defender chooses the attack action, it may make two attacks with whichever weapon it is equipped with.

action.name: Sleek Short Sword
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.
Two-handed Glaive. Melee Weapon Attack: +4, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Medium Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} +2, range 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Conscript (1/Day)
entries: As an action, Jeholrak Defender may call a citizen to assist it. Choose another non-player character humanoid within 50 ft. of it that can see and  hear Jeholrak Defender.

Jeholrak Defender makes a {@skill Persuasion} check with a DC equal to the target humanoid's Charisma score. If that  humanoid has a lawful alignment, then Jeholrak Defender makes this {@skill Persuasion} check at advantage. If successful, the humanoid must assist Jeholrak Defender however they  can for 1 minute, but will not harm an ally of theirs.

monster.name: Jeholrak Infiltrator
languages: any two languages (usually Common and Archosauric) and Thieves' cant

trait.name: Pheromonal Influence
entries: Jeholrak Infiltrator may cast the  following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (with a spell save DC of 13):
2/day each: Charm Person, Animal Friendship

1/day: Suggestion Jeholrak Infiltrator may cast these spells without components (even while appearing as a Jeholrak Politician). The only indication that anything is happening is a slightly sweet smell in the air.

trait.name: In Plain Sight
entries: When first encountered, the Jeholrak Infiltrator will be disguised as an unarmed Jeholrak

trait.name: Politician
entries: A passive {@skill Perception} of 18 will reveal that they are in fact an assassin. Alternatively, a {@skill Perception} check of 15 or higher will reveal them if a player is actively looking.
The Jeholrak Infiltrator may choose to take on the disguise of a Jeholrak Politician instead of hiding when succeeding a {@skill Stealth} check.

When Jeholrak Infiltrator attacks while disguised as a  Jeholrak Politician, they attack with advantage and, if their first attack hits, it scores a critical hit. The disguise is then lost at the end of Jeholrak Infiltrator's turn.

trait.name: Flee The Scene!
entries: Jeholrak Infiltrator may dash, disengage, or hide as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Jeholrak Infiltrator chooses the attack action, it may make any two combinations of Gnarled Kriss or Razor Shuriken attacks.

action.name: Gnarled Kriss
entries: {@atk mw} +7, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If this attack was made with advantage, it does an  additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

action.name: Razor Shuriken
entries: {@atk rw} +7, range 50 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If this attack was made with advantage, it does an  additional {@damage 2d6} slashing damage.

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Rippling Muscles
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster has advantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and  {@skill Intimidation} checks.

trait.name: Forge Master
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster is an expert blacksmith, has expertise with Smith's Tools, and resistance to fire damage (included above).

trait.name: Forge Armament
entries: Ankylier Forgemaster can create a metal
+1 weapon or armour during a long rest, so long as it has the raw materials and an anvil.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Ankylier Forgemaster chooses the attack action, it can make two Forge Greatmaul attacks.

action.name: Forge Greatmaul (+1)
entries: {@atk mw} +10, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@dice 1d10 + 6}) magical bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Clubbed Tail. Melee Weapon Attack: +9, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Legendary Action:
entries: Give Order. Ankylier Forgemaster can give a verbal command to an Ankylier Karl within 60 ft. that  can hear it. That Ankylier Karl may then immediately move up to 25 ft. and perform an action.

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Karl's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Show of Strength (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, for the next 1 minute Ankylier Karl may give itself advantage on its  next Strength check or Strength saving throw, but if it does, it has disadvantage on its next Dexterity check or  Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Impressive Physique
entries: Ankylier Karl has advantage on  {@skill Intimidation} checks.

action.name: Smith's Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Clubbed Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +2, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ankylier Enchanter's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Osteoderms
entries: Ankylier Enchanter's AC is increased by 3 (included above), but it cannot benefit from its Dexterity modifier to improve its AC.

trait.name: Industrial Enchanter
entries: When performing the Enchant Weapon or Enchant Armour action, Ankylier Enchanter may choose to spend an hour doing this instead of a single action. If it does so, the enchantment becomes permanent until replaced by a similar effect and is not lost when another weapon/armour is enchanted.

trait.name: Arcane Intuition
entries: Ankylier Enchanter has advantage on  saving throws to prevent it from being {@condition charmed} or cursed.

action.name: Enchant Weapon
entries: Select a weapon that Ankylier Enchanter can see and is within 40 ft. of it. For the next 1 minute, that weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of  any type of your choosing.

If that weapon already had this effect (or a similar effect) applied to it, the new effect temporarily overrides it. Only one weapon may be enchanted by this ability at a time and if a new weapon is enchanted, the effect ends on the  previous one.

action.name: Enchant Armour
entries: Select a set of armour that Ankylier Enchanter can see and is within 40 ft. of it. For the next 1 minute, that armour provides the wearer with resistance to  one damage type of your choosing.

If that armour already had this effect (or a similar effect) applied to it, the new effect temporarily overrides it. Only one armour may be enchanted by this ability at a time and if a  new armour is enchanted, the effect ends on the previous one.

action.name: Blessing Rod
entries: {@atk mw} +6, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

trait.name: Parrying Guard
entries: When hit by a melee or ranged attack, as  a reaction, Limukin Champion may attempt to deflect that  attack with its Dinosaur-bone Greatsword. The damage of  that incoming attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10}.

trait.name: Venomous Miasma
entries: A faint purple mist emanates from between Limukin Champion's armour plates. Each non?Limukin creature that starts its turn within or comes within 10 ft. of Limukin Champion must succeed a  {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Limukin Champion is also immune to poison damage (included above). and has disadvantage on  stealth checks.

trait.name: Grapple Wire
entries: Limukin Champion can use a grappling rope to scale trees and traverse canopies with ease. It has a climbing speed of 30 ft. (included above) and can jump up to 25 ft. from standing still. This Grapple can also be used to snare and pull at enemies.

trait.name: Raging
entries: While in combat, Limukin Champion has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and  slashing damage (included above).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: If Limukin Champion chooses the attack action, it may make three attacks with its Dinosaur-bone Greatsword.
Dinosaur-bone Greatsword. Melee Weapon Attack: +9, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Grapple Wire
entries: {@atk rw} +6, range 60 ft., one target. Hit 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

A Small or Medium creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} until the end of its next turn (escape {@dc 14}) and is pulled 10 ft. closer to Limukin Champion. If that creature was flying, it is pulled to the ground, but does not take falling damage.

monster.name: Limukin Worldshaper
languages: any two (usually Common and Archosauric) and Primordial

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Limukin Worldshaper's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Venom Unbound
entries: When Limukin Worldshaper is reduced  to 0 hit points, each non-Limukin creature within 20 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. On a  success they take half as much damage and are not {@condition poisoned}.
Limukin Worldshaper is also resistant to poison damage (included above).

trait.name: Defender of the World
entries: Limukin Worldshaper has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and may attack with  its Maelstrom Rod as a bonus action.

action.name: Maelstrom Rod
entries: {@atk rw} +6, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@dice 2d6 + 3}) [see below] damage.
Roll a {@dice d6} and consult the list below to determine the damage type of this attack.
Cold
Fire
Lightning
Thunder
Acid
Force

trait.name: Toxic Secretion
entries: Any creature that hits Limukin Young Hunter with a melee attack suffers {@damage 1d4} poison damage.
Limukin Young Hunter also has resistance to poison damage (included above).

trait.name: Young and Naive
entries: Limukin Young Hunter has disadvantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Natural Hunter
entries: Limukin Young Hunter can use its  Dexterity modifier for {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Survival} checks (included above).

action.name: Toxin-Coated Slingshot
entries: {@atk rw} +3, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Skinning Knife
entries: {@atk mw} +3, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Vinerope Net
entries: As an action. Limukin Young Hunter may throw a hooked and weighted net over a creature within 20 ft. That creature must succeed a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 11} Strength check).

monster.name: Dromeus Trader (Children of Seth)
languages: any four (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

trait.name: Haggle
entries: Dromeus Trader has advantage on {@skill Persuasion} checks while negotiating prices.

trait.name: Uncommon Wares
entries: You may select one common or  uncommon magic item for Dromeus Trader to have (DM's choice). It may use that item and can be convinced to sell it.

trait.name: Global Trader
entries: Dromeus Trader has proficiency in {@skill Athletics} (included above) and may remove a level of  {@condition exhaustion} after completing a short rest.

action.name: Bag'o'Coins
entries: {@atk mw} +1, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.
When a creature is hit by this attack {@dice 1d6} coins are scattered on the ground. Roll {@dice 1d4} and consult the list below to  determine the type of coins:
Copper
Silver
Gold
Mysterious

monster.name: Dromeus Emissary (Children of Seth)
languages: any five (usually Common, Archosauric, and three other languages)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dromeus Emissary's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks).
It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Diplomatic Immunity
entries: Dromeus Emissary is always considered to be friendly to law enforcement - guards of  any kind will defend it if able. Dromeus Emissary is also immune to charm effects.

trait.name: Global Migrator
entries: Dromeus Emissary has proficiency in {@skill Athletics} (included above).

action.name: Letter Opener
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage

monster.name: Dromeus Memory-Keeper (Children of Seth)
languages: any four (usually Common, Archosauric, and two other languages)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It may cast the following spells:

trait.name: Mind's Eye
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper is able to glimpse into the thoughts of nearby creatures, so long as they are focused on it. Melee attacks against Dromeus Memory-Keeper are made at disadvantage and Dromeus Memory-Keeper has advantage on Intelligence saving throws.

trait.name: Split Focus
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper may make an  attack with its Ceremonial Memory-Channelling Staff as  a bonus action.

trait.name: Global Migrator
entries: Dromeus Memory-Keeper has proficiency in {@skill Athletics} (included above).

action.name: Ceremonial Memory-Channelling Staff
entries: {@atk rw} +8, range 50 ft., one target. Hit 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d10} psychic damage.

trait.name: Constructed
entries: When a Construct of Flesh is created, {@footnote it gains its creator's alignment|The book defines the Construct of Flesh as being the same as its creator, however that's not something can be defined in this format} the creator chooses one of the abilities listed below and one of the attacks. Construct of Flesh then loses all abilities and  attacks, excluding the chosen two.

trait.name: Arboreal
entries: Construct of Flesh gains a climb speed of 30 ft. and has advantage on {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Acrobatics} checks.

trait.name: Volant
entries: Construct of Flesh gains a fly speed of 30 ft.

trait.name: Nocturnal
entries: Construct of Flesh gains Darkvision (120 ft.) and has advantage on {@skill Stealth} and {@skill Perception} checks.

trait.name: Robust
entries: Construct of Flesh's AC is increased to 17 and its  maximum hit points are increased to 50 + 2*Your Level.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: Construct of Flesh's speed is increased to  45 ft. and its Dexterity ability score is increased by 2.
If it succeeds a Dexterity saving throw to avoid half incoming damage, it instead avoids all of that damage.

action.name: Vicious Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +(4 + PB), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 +  PB} piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d4} poison damage.

action.name: Mighty Gore
entries: {@atk mw} +(4 + PB), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 +  PB} bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Noxious Spit
entries: {@atk rw} +(4 + PB), range 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 +  PB} acid damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Gruesome Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +(4 + PB), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d6 +  PB} slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.
A creature hit by this attack must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of  Construct of Flesh until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: 12th-Level Feat.
entries: Pre-requisite: Spellcasting Class.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Enchant:
entries: As an action, you can select an item you can see and touch, and enchant it. You may only have a single item enchanted at any given point, and when you use this  action, any previous enchants you have made end. The item gains one of the following enchantments based on its  type:

entries.name: ♦ Weapon:
entries: For the next minute that weapon deals {@damage 1d6} additional damage of any damage type that your spells can deal. At level 16, you may add your proficiency bonus to this additional damage.

entries.name: ♦ Armour:
entries: For the next minute that armour provides the  wearer with resistance to one damage type that your spells can deal. At level 16, you may select two damage types that this armour provides resistance to.

entries.name: ♦ Wondrous:
entries: For the next minute, that item provides the bearer advantage on saving throws and checks to  prevent or end a condition of your choice. At level 16, you may select two conditions that this item provides advantage for.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Catch Jaws:
entries: If a creature hits you with an attack that uses  its mouth (i.e. a bite or maw attack), you can use your reaction to reduce any incoming damage by {@dice 1d10} + your level.

entries.name: Heroic Moment:
entries: The first time you fail an {@skill Athletics} check each day, you may choose to succeed it instead.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Heat Handler:
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Assess Volcano:
entries: If you can see a volcano, you may take 10 minutes to assess it. If you do, you are able to determine whether it is likely to erupt in either the next >100 years, 10 years, 1 year, 30 days, 7 days, or 24 hours. If the volcano is going to erupt in the next 7 days or less, you are able to  determine the minimum safe distance from it.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Bush Wrangler:
entries: You gain +1 to your Constitution or  Strength score.
"What a beauty!": You have advantage on Animal
Handling checks and advantage on checks to grapple beasts.

entries.name: "Crikey!"
entries: : Any Large, Medium, or Small beast you are grappling cannot select you as a target for its attacks.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Animal Behaviour Expert:
entries: You have expertise in {@skill Animal Handling} checks.

entries.name: Bespoke Saddles:
entries: Creatures you tame gain +1 to their  AC, hit rolls, and damage.

entries.name: 4th-Level Feat.
entries: Pre-requisite: A Wisdom ability score of at least 12.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Stone Whisper:
entries: You can cast the {@spell Stone Shape} spell once per day without requiring material components and  without using a spell slot. This is increased to three times per day at level 10, five times per day at level 15, and an  unlimited number of times per day at level 20.

entries.name: Whisper Back:
entries: You have a {@sense Tremorsense|MM} of 10 ft.

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Portable Lamp:
entries: You possess a physical lamp that weighs 1 lb. and can produce 20 ft. of {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} and a further 20 ft. of {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. The lamp attaches to your belt/armour and  does not need to be carried.

entries.name: Familiar Rumble:
entries: While underground, you have a  {@sense Tremorsense|MM} of 30 ft. If you already have {@sense Tremorsense|MM}, its  range is increased by 20 ft.
"Cave-in!": You have advantage on any skill check or  saving throw to escape falling natural rocks (i.e. from cliffs, caves, tunnels, etc., but not from traps or buildings).

entries.name: Repeatable:
entries: No.

entries.name: Taxonomist:
entries: When rolling a {@skill Survival} check to identify the  remains of any beast, plant, or humanoid, any roll of a 1-9 is treated as a 10.

entries.name: Fieldwork:
entries: You have expertise in {@skill Survival} checks when tracking a beast.

entries.name: Functional Morphology:
entries: The first time you encounter a  beast that you have not seen before, you are able to discern either its AC, maximum hit points, or one resistance it has (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Big Game Hunter
entries: Big Game Hunters are rangers that revel in maritime battles of attrition and grit. While anyone can be a fisher, an Big Game Hunter uses the lessons they have learned on the water as a basis for how they hunt across the multiverse.

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Specialist
entries: You gain proficiency with all ranged weapons (including thrown weapons and firearms), however you lose proficiency with all melee weapons. If a weapon can be used as both melee and ranged, you are only proficient when using it for a ranged attack (even when in melee range). If you selected Duelling as your Fighting Style, it is now applicable to dual wielded, single-handed ranged weapons (such as throwing knives, thrown hand axes, hand crossbows, etc.), but not melee weapons, or you can re-select a different Fighting Style. Additionally, you may use a ranged weapon while an enemy is within 5 ft. of you without disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Game Hunter
entries: You replace your Favoured Enemy type with Favoured Enemy (Large Creatures). At 6th level, instead of selecting another Favoured Enemy, you gain Favoured Enemy (Huge Creatures). At 14th level, instead of selecting another Favoured Enemy, you also gain Favoured Enemy (Gargantuan Creatures). At each of these intervals, you may learn one language associated with a creature of that size that you have slain (if it has languages).

subclassFeature.name: Bolas
entries: When making a ranged attack against a target creature of size Large or larger, on a hit, you may wrap a bolas around the creature, reducing its speed to 0 instead of dealing damage. On its turn, the creature may attempt to break the bolas using its bonus action. To do so, it must succeed a Strength check with a DC equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus. You may remove the bolas as an action if you are within 5 ft. of the creature. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, then require a short or long rest to regain all expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Special Shot
entries: You have a number of charges of Special Shot equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all spent charges after you complete a long rest. When you make a ranged attack, you may use a charge of Special Shot to apply one of the following effects:

items: Drill Shot: This attack receives an additional +5 to the hit roll.

Trick Shot: If you know approximately where a creature is (through sound, blindsight, or knowledge of their location etc.), they are in range, and your ammunition can reach them in an uninterrupted path, then they do not gain the benefits for half and three-quarter cover, and full cover instead provides them with a +5 to their AC.
Power shot: Do not roll damage for this attack. Instead you cause the maximum damage you could roll on a successful hit. If you critically hit the creature, you still roll the additional damage dice.

subclassFeature.name: The Hunt Continues
entries: After killing a Favoured Enemy, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points are lost after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Bolas
entries: You may double your proficiency bonus to the DC required of the Strength check to break your bolas.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack three times, rather than twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Special Shot
entries: You have a number of charges of Special Shot equal to twice your proficiency bonus, rather than just equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: You have advantage on attacks against a Favoured Enemy. At a glance you know how many hit points a Favoured Enemy has remaining. Additionally, while your Hunter's Mark is active on a living target and you are pursuing that target, you do not need to sleep or eat.

subclassFeature.name: Finish the Hunt
entries: As an action, you can declare that you are attempting to finish a target off. Select a creature that you can see, is within 60 ft., unobscured, and your Favoured Enemy. You make a single ranged attack against the creature that automatically hits so long as your character (and you) say a quip or one-liner, such as {@i “This one's mine!”}, {@i “I've got you now…”}, or {@i “Hasta la vista.”}. If you do not provide a quip or one-liner, {@b the attack misses}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Cycles
entries: Druids of the Circle of Cycles revel in the roar of anunbridled thunderstorm, either finding kinship in its chaos or in the stillness found between them. These circle members tend to meet in open fields or on tower rooftops during storms, rather than in the quiet forest glens of other druidic circles. They feel the push and pull of positive and negative forces within nature, using it to transform into streaking bolts of devastating lightning.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, your deep-rooted connection to plantlife grants you the ability to cast certain spells. This connection grants you access to some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Circle of Cycles Spells table.

Once you gain access to a circle spell, you always have it prepared, and it does not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that does not appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.caption: Circle of Cycles Spells
rows: {@spell find the path}, {@spell contingency}, {@spell flesh to stone}, {@spell investiture of stone|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Wild Shape
entries: Whenever you Wild Shape, you may choose to add one of the following additional characteristics to whatever you Wild Shape into:

items: You gain a climb speed of 30 ft., or it increases by 20 ft.
You gain a flight speed of 15 ft., or it increases by 10 ft. (optional rule at the DMs discretion, we suggest limiting this to Tiny and Small creatures you wild shape into until level 8).
You can breathe underwater and gain a swim speed of 30 ft., or it increases by 20 ft.
You gain darkvision (60 ft.) or increase your darkvision by an additional 30 ft.
You may change the type of damage one of your attacks deals to poison or acid damage.

entries: From level 8 you may instead select two additional characteristics, and from level 14 you may instead select three additional characteristics. These Adaptive Wild Shapes override the limitations of the standard Wild Shape feature.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of Time
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a melee attack, you may select one of the dice you rolled and change its damage type to necrotic.

subclassFeature.name: Old Soul
entries: You age at half the normal rate - effectively doubling your lifespan. This increase stacks with Timeless Body when you reach level 18 (increasing your lifespan twenty-fold).

subclassFeature.name: Celestial Alignment
entries: You have the ability to mimic celestial events to a limited degree. As an action, you may enact one of the following events, then must complete a long rest before you can do so again:

items: Partial Eclipse: You may shroud an outside area of up to 10 miles in diameter in non-magical darkness for 10 minutes.
Full Lunar Phase: You may illuminate an outside area of up to 10 miles in diameter in natural light for 10 minutes.
Constellation of the Warrior: For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any melee attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
Constellation of the Sage: For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any spell attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
Constellation of the Outlaw: For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you can reroll any ranged attack roll of a natural 1 once per turn.
Planetary Alignment: For the next minute, you and any allies within 15 ft. of you gain proficiency in all saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Hibernation
entries: You gain the ability to go into a deep hibernation at will. This hibernation lasts for a minimum of 24 hours, but has no maximum length. While in this state, you do not age, do not need to eat, drink or sleep. After the minimum 24 hours has passed, you become aware of your surroundings and can wake at any point you choose. When you wake up from your hibernation, you gain the benefits of a long rest, gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level, and can permanently change how old you appear to be.

subclassFeature.name: Glimpse Future
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. When an ally that you can see makes a Dexterity saving throw, you may use your reaction to give them advantage on that Dexterity saving throw, so long as they can hear and understand you.

subclassFeature.name: Commune with Past
entries: During hibernation, you can learn details about your world's past. These can be details that were long forgotten and have no written history, but must have been common knowledge at some point in time.
This can include things such as ancient legends, tribal rivalries, and noticeable differences between the past and the current time.

subclassFeature.name: Commune with Future
entries: During hibernation, you can learn details about your world's possible future. These details must be common knowledge for people of the time explored and are what would occur if your party were to be absent for the rest of their lifetimes. This can include things such as legends, civilisation rivalries, and noticeable differences between the current time and the future.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Evolution
entries: When casting {@spell evolution/devolution|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs}, if you concentrate on this spell for the full 10 minutes, the changes become permanent until Evolution/Devolution is cast on this creature again or until that creature completes a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Future Sight
entries: So long as you are not incapacitated or blinded, you have advantage on all attacks and all attacks against you have disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Bonesculptor
entries: This gory reimagining of a blacksmith makes armour, weapons, and trinkets from the carcasses of slain great creatures. Through a combination of runic enhancements and harnessing the life essence of the slain beast, they are able to imbue their designs with potent magical energies.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Harvest
entries: You can harvest resources from slain creatures that you may use to craft items. The table below outlines suggestions for managing the resources harvested from a creature and how long it takes to harvest from that creature. When harvesting, the DM may decide (or roll) how much, if any, of that resource you can harvest within the appropriate range of values, These are just guidelines, and we recommend that you discuss this with your DM when the moment arises.
Your allies may assist you in harvesting. If at least two other humanoids assist you in harvesting, you may halve the harvest time taken for each creature you harvest from.

subclassFeature.name: Melder of Flesh and Bone
entries: You gain proficiency in Heavy Armour, Leatherworker's tools, and Smith's tools if you did not have them already. You can craft armour, shields, and weapons from the parts of slain creatures. The table opposite outlines suggestions for the resource requirements for crafting these items and you must use Leatherworker's tools and Smith's tools to do so. These are just guidelines, and we recommend that you discuss this with your DM when the moment arises.
You can craft a single item during a long rest. During this time, you may apply any other improvements to that item that your class would allow.

entries.caption: Suggested Crafting Table
rows: 4 Hide or Skin, 1 Feathers or Scales
{@item Breastplate|PHB} or {@item Half Plate Armor|PHB|Half Plate}
4 Hide or Skin, 1 Bone or Chitin, 2 Feathers or Scales
6 Bone or Chitin, 2 Hide or Scales
1 Bone or Chitin, OR 1 Horn, Fangs, Claws, or Mandibles
{@item Shortsword|PHB}, {@item Mace|PHB}, {@item Light Crossbow|PHB}, {@item Handaxe|PHB}, etc.
2 Bone or Chitin, 1 Hide or Skin, OR 1 Bone or Chitin, 1 Horn, Fangs, Claws, or Mandibles
3 Bone or Chitin, 2 Hide or Skin, OR 2 Bone or Chitin, 2 Horn, Fangs, Claws, or Mandibles
2 Hide or Skin, 5 Bone or Chitin, OR 3 Horn, Fangs, Claws, or Mandibles, 3 Bone or Chitin
3 Hide or Skin, 1 Bone or Chitin, OR 3 Bone or Chitin
1 Horn, Fangs, Claws, or Mandibles, 1 Hide or Skin

subclassFeature.name: Body Knowledge
entries: You have advantage on Medicine checks, and you know the cantrip {@spell Spare the Dying} in addition to your other cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Bonesculptor Spells
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically imbue effects to create a blast disk from a flat stone you touch.
You can create one blast disk at the end of a long rest, imbuing it with one effect from the Blast Disks table, which you can later trigger by detonating the disk.

Creating a blast disk requires that you have {@item mason's tools|phb} on your person, and any disk that you imbue with this feature lasts until it detonates or the end of your next long rest, when the magic dissipates.

entries.caption: Bonesculptor Spells
rows: {@spell cause fear|XGE}, {@spell inflict wounds}, {@spell speak with animals}
{@spell raise dead}, {@spell commune with nature}, {@spell danse macabre|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Butcher
entries: You gain proficiency in one weapon type of your choosing. When making an attack roll, if you are attacking with a weapon that you crafted, you may use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for both the bonuses to hit and to damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Crafting
entries: You better understand the creation of items from flesh and bone. The items you craft using your Melder of Flesh and Bone ability become +1 items of their respective type.

subclassFeature.name: Construct of Flesh
entries: During a long rest, you may craft a {@creature Construct of Flesh|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} instead of an item. This requires 4 hide/skin, 4 bone/chitin, and any combination of 4 horns, feathers, scales, fangs, claws, or mandibles.

The Construct of Flesh is a friendly undead companion that obeys your commands. It is a Medium creature with the appearance of your choice (although usually fairly gruesome) and the statistics outlined in the Construct of Flesh stat block. You may only have a single {@creature Construct of Flesh|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} at a time. If you create a second one, the first collapses into the components you used to create it.

In combat, the Construct of Flesh takes its turn immediately after yours. On your turn you may use bonus action to command it to attack, otherwise it may only move and {@action Dodge} on its turn. It may still use its reaction regardless of whether you commanded it to attack or not.

subclassFeature.name: Artisan Crafter
entries: Your knowledge of your craft deepens to that of an experienced crafter. The items you craft using your Melder of Flesh and Bone ability become +2 items of their respective type.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Butcher
entries: You gain proficiency in another weapon type of your choosing.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Construct of Flesh
entries: You may select a second ability for your Construct of Flesh from its initial list of abilities. The selected ability cannot be the same as the first one you picked. The Construct of Flesh also gains Multiattack, allowing two attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Master Crafter
entries: At 15th level, you're an uncontested master of explosives, and your blast disks are unusually potent. You now roll twice as as many dice when dealing damage with blast disks. For example, a corrosive blast disk now deals {@damage 6d6} acid damage on a failed saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Body Modification
entries: Over the course of a long rest, you can incorporate one set of your crafted armour and up to two of your crafted weapons into your own flesh. They become a part of you and can only be removed if you choose to remove them over the course of a long rest. The weapons can be concealed within your body, and you may use a bonus action to draw them out.

subclassFeature.name: Minion Master
entries: The maximum hit points of your {@creature Construct of Flesh|DrDhrolinsDictionaryofDinosaurs} is increased by a further 60 hit points and its AC is increased by 2 (cumulative with the Robust ability if you selected it). You may select a second attack for your Construct of Flesh from its initial list of attacks. The selected attack cannot be the same as the first one you picked. All attacks made by your Construct of Flesh deal an additional {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Evolution/Devolution
entries: By touching a creature, you can cause it to take on attributes of its ancestors or descendants. A creature may accept these changes willingly or must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you may pick one of the following changes and apply it to the creature's stat block for as long as you maintain {@status concentration}.

items: 1 - Increase or decrease the damage of all of the creature's attacks by {@dice 1d4}.
2 - Increase or decrease the creature's movement speed by 20 ft.
3 - The creature gains a climbing speed equal to half its movement, or its climbing speed is reduced by 30 ft (it can be reduced to 0).
4 - The creature gains a flying speed equal to half its movement, or its flying speed is reduced by 30 ft (it can be reduced to 0).

5 - Select one of the creature's attacks that cause slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage and change that damage type to poison, acid, fire, cold, or lightning, or select one of the creature's attacks that deal poison, acid, fire, cold, or lightning damage and change that damage type to slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage.

6 - The creature gains {@sense darkvision} 60 ft., or reduces its {@sense darkvision} (if it has it) by 60 ft. (it can be reduced to 0). If the creature does not have {@sense darkvision}, you can reduce its vision by 60 ft. (to a minimum of 10 ft.).
7 - Increase the creature's maximum hit points by {@dice 1d4 + 4}, or reduce its maximum hit points by {@dice 1d4 + 4} (to a minimum of 1).

entriesHigherLevel: At higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may pick another trait to change for each slot above 2nd level. You cannot pick the same trait more than once.

table.name: Volcanic Lake
table.caption: Volcanic Lake
rows: {@b Acidic volcanic lake}. Water from this lake causes {@dice 1d4} acid damage. A creature submerged in it takes {@dice 2d4} acid damage per round.

{@b Limnic eruption}. If the waters are disturbed, a gaseous cloud 15 ft. in diameter erupts and drifts 5 ft. per round in a random (or wind blown) direction. It causes {@dice 1d6} acid damage and {@dice 2d4} poison damage per round to any creature inside of it. The cloud can be dissipated by a powerful continuous wind.

table.name: Volcanic Event
table.caption: Volcanic Event
rows: {@b The volcano stirs}. Mild tremors rock the land and the sky darkens from ash. Re-roll on this table in {@dice 3d6} hours’ time.
{@b Falling ash}. The sky darkens as burning cinders ignite fires throughout the forest. All native creatures begin to flee the area. Re-roll on this table in {@dice 3d6} hours’ time.

{@b Eruption!} Slow flowing lava erupts, travailing at 10 ft. per round from the volcano's peak, igniting everything it touches. It flows downhill up to 900 ft., dealing 4d8 fire damage per round to creatures in contact with it. It deals a further 4d8 fire damage and 8d8 bludgeoning damage per round to creatures smothered by it. Creatures native to the Elemental Plane of Fire are unaffected.
{@b Explosive eruption!} Heavy tremors rock the land as a large explosion occurs at the peak. All nearby lakes undergo a Limnic Eruption (see {@table Volcanic Lake|4D} table).

{@b Cataclysm!} The volcano blows its peak cataclysmically. Fire and rock rains down in all directions. Every minute spent unsheltered and within 1 mile of the volcano, a creature must succeed a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, or take 2d8 fire damage and 2d8 bludgeoning damage. The eruption lasts 1 hour.

table.name: Soupy Sediment
table.caption: soupy sediment
intro: Any creature that takes the dash action while moving across the mangrove sediment (touching the ground) must roll a d6 and consult the table below.
rows: Its speed becomes 0 until its next turn. It may use a bonus action to make a Strength or Intelligence check with a DC of 14. On a success, it is instead considered to be moving through difficult terrain until its next turn.
It treats the ground as difficult terrain.

table.name: Carnivore: Small and Medium Carnivore
table.caption: Carnivore: Small and Medium Carnivore
rows: {@b Asleep} - The creature is asleep. If awoken by a failed Stealth check (with a DC equal to the sleeping creature's passive Perception), treat this result as an 8.

{@b Skittish} - The creature will attack for one round, then attempt to flee. If this creature is present in numbers equal to or greater than the party, or if it is larger than every party member, treat this result as an 8 instead.
{@b Defensively fearful} - The creature will attempt to intimidate the players and attack if provoked. If it is reduced to half health or less, it will attempt to flee.
{@b Aggressively territorial} - The creature attempts to intimidate the party. If they attack it, or do not leave, it will attack and fight to the death.
{@b Opportunistic feeder} - The creature attacks, attempting to kill and devour the players. It will only attempt to flee if near death.

table.name: Carnivore: Ambush Carnivore
table.caption: Carnivore: Ambush Carnivore
rows: {@b Waiting in ambush} - The creature uses any abilities it has to keep entirely hidden, attacking at anything (other than its own species) that comes within half of its walking speed. It will cease attacking and flee, attempting to hide again if near death.
{@b Basking} - The creature is conspicuously visible, basking in the sun to warm itself. It will only attack if threatened and will attempt to flee if reduced to below half health.
{@b Patrolling territory} - The creature is actively patrolling its hunting or mating grounds. It will attack and fight to the death anything it encounters but won’t pursue them if they flee.

table.name: Carnivore: Large Carnivore
table.caption: Carnivore: Large Carnivore
rows: {@b Asleep} - The creature is asleep. If awoken by a failed Stealth check (with a DC equal to the sleeping creature's passive Perception), treat this result as an 8.

{@b Rest and digest} - The creature is aware of the party, but cares little and has already fed. If they come within 10 ft. of it, it will attempt to intimidate them and will only attack if they touch it or attack it.

{@b Irritable - The creature will attempt to drive the players away with an intimidating threat display. If they don’t leave or if they attack, it will fight back. It will only attempt to flee if near death. If it escapes, it will recover to full strength (complete a long rest) and then actively hunt the players.

{@b Territorial challenge} - The creature perceives the party’s intrudance as a challenge. It attempts to intimidate the party once, then immediately attacks if the players do not flee. It will fight to the death.

{@b Actively hunting} - The creature attacks the players, only fleeing if near death. It will focus on the weakest-looking member of the party. If the party escapes, it will continue to pursue them as long as it is able. To track the players, the creature must roll a contested Survival check vs the party member with the lowest survival modifier. Abilities that cover the party’s track (such as a Ranger’s Pass Without Trace) renders the creature unable to track the party.

table.name: Herbivore: Large Herbivore
table.caption: Herbivore: Large Herbivore
rows: {@b Oblivious} - The sheer size of this creature makes the party seem like little more than pests. It will only attack if they attack it first. Ignore this result if anything in the party is the same size category as this creature.
{@b Fearful} - The strangeness of the party intimidates this creature. It avoids them if possible and flees if they approach.
{@b Challenged} - The creature will make a threat display, attempting to intimidate the party. If approached or attacked, it will fight to the death.

{@b Rutting} - Select either oblivious or fearful and apply that result to all members of this species in this encounter, bar one or two (or more depending on population size) individuals. Those exceptions are rutting and will attack the party. They will knock players unconscious, but not purposely kill them. They will submit and cease attacking if reduced to below half hit points. If there are two or more rutting creatures of the same species, they will prioritise attacking each other first.

table.name: Herbivore: Armoured/Slow Herbivore
table.caption: Herbivore: Armoured/Slow Herbivore
rows: {@b Immutable defence} - This creature trusts its defences and ignores the party. It will only attack if it is attacked first. If the attacker ceases attacking, so too will this creature.
{@b Stand ground} - The creature makes a show of strength, stomping and posturing. It will attack if approached or attacked. However, it will not pursue a fleeing target.
{@b Push back} - The creature immediately charges the party on sight, letting out an angry cry. It will attack until the opponent dies or flees, but will not pursue a fleeing target.

table.name: Herbavore:Small and Medium Herbivore
table.caption: Herbavore:Small and Medium Herbivore
rows: {@b Skittish} - The creature will attempt to flee and only attack if trapped or immobilised.
{@b Frozen} - The creature will stay motionless until attacked. It will then either flee or fight, fleeing when near death.
{@b Backed into a corner} - The creature will fight to the death.

table.name: Minor Mutation
table.caption: Minor Mutation
rows: Tusked – {@i Two bulbous teeth protrude from this creature’s lower jaw}.
If this creature hits with an attack that uses its head, the hit creature must succeed a DC (8 + Strength bonus + PB) Strength saving throw or take an additional 1d6 + PB piercing damage.
Extended apnea – {@i High-capacity lungs allow this creature to hold its breath for a prolonged period}.
This creature may hold its breath for up to an hour with no detrimental side-effects.
Symbiotic – {@i This creature lives benevolently among another species}.

Select another non-humanoid creature. All creatures of that species treat this creature as an ally. Additionally, this creature gains proficiency in all ability checks while within 5 ft. of the selected creature.
Diminutive size – {@i This creature is particularly small}.
Decrease the size category of this creature by one stage (to a minimum of Tiny), decrease any damage it deals by 2 (to a minimum of 1), but add +2 to its Dexterity saving throws.
Rapid coagulation – {@i Blood oozing from wounds instantly clots when exposed to air}.
This creature cannot lose more than one third of its HP in a single turn from any combination of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.
Elongate – {@i The limbs, tail, or muzzle of this creature are particularly long}.
Select one melee attack this creature has and increase its range by 5 ft.
Vivid plumage – {@i Beautifully coloured feathers or fur cover this creature’s body}.
This creature has advantage on any Charisma checks.
Thermal vision – {@i Fleshy red spots on this creature’s head allow it to detect heat}.
This creature can see other creatures while in any light level but struggles to distinguish them from other heat sources (such as torches).
Pachycephalisation – {@i The skull of this creature is huge and bulbous, giving it bony nodules that it can use as a weapon}.

If this creature moves at least 20 ft. towards a creature, it can use its bonus action to make a skull bash attack. If that creature is within 5 ft., it must succeed a DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB) Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 + PB bludgeoning damage.
Reinforced muscle fibres – {@i Metallic fibres line this creature’s muscles}.
This creature has advantage on Strength saving throws.
Prehensile tail – {@i This creature can control its tail as though it were a limb, grasping or attacking with it}.

This creature can use its bonus action to attack a creature within 5/10 ft. (DM's choice). That creature must succeed a DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB) Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 + PB bludgeoning damage.
Alopecia – {@i All feathers, hair, and scales fall away from this creature, leaving only bare skin}.
This creature is vulnerable to slashing damage. Instead of increasing its CR with this mutation, reduce it.
Digital pads – {@i Soft cat-like paw pads cover the soles of this creature’s feet}.
This creature makes no sound when it moves. Once per day, the first time it fails a Stealth check, it may instead choose to pass.
Plains/Scrublands ; Tundra/Polar Frozen ; Temperate Forest/Conifer Forest
Hypertrophy – {@i Huge, bulging muscles cover this creature’s body}.
This creature has advantage on Strength checks.
Spinnerets – {@i Silk-producing glands protrude from this creature’s body, allowing it to spin webs quickly}.
This creature may cast {@spell Web|PHB} at 2nd level (spell save DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB)) without components and without requiring a spell slot.
Aquatic – {@i This creature has webbed hands and feet, as well as gills on its neck}.
This creature gains a swim speed equal to its walking speed and may potentially breathe underwater (DM’s choice).
Thermal sink – {@i A specialised organ in this creature’s chest is able to absorb heat}.
As a bonus action, all other creatures within 5 ft. must succeed a DC (8 + Constitution bonus) Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 + PB cold damage.
Toxic secretions – {@i Poisons seep through this creature’s skin or scales}.
When hit by a melee attack, this creature may use its reaction to deal 1d6 + PB poison damage to the attacking creature.
Sail-backed – {@i A row of tall skin-covered bony protrusions line this creature’s back, linking to form a sail}.
This creature gets +2 to Intimidation checks and is unaffected by temperatures as high as 40°C Celsius (104°F Fahrenheit).
Bristle-backed – {@i Large quills or spines protrude from this creature’s back}.

entries: In addition to any other attack, this creature may make one ranged attack with the profile:
Bristle Shot. Ranged Weapon Attack: range, 30 ft., +(Dexterity bonus + PB) to hit, one target. Hit: {@dice 1d6} + PB piercing damage.

rows: Puffable coat – {@i This creature can puff itself up with a thick fluffy coat of fur or feathers}.

When hit by an attack or when failing a saving throw, this creature may use its reaction to reduce incoming cold damage by 1d6 + PB. This creature is unaffected by temperatures as low as -20°C Celsius (-4°F Fahrenheit).
Photosynthetic – {@i This creature has a vibrant green colour, as it’s skin, hair, or feathers contain plant-like cells}.
This creature requires only a few hours of sunlight for a full day’s nourishment. It also counts as a plant for the purposes of spells and abilities that target plants.
Floral mimicry – {@i This creature’s features look remarkably plant-like. Small frills of skin and feathers mimic leaves and flowers}.
While motionless, this creature is indistinguishable from plant life. A DC (8 + Charisma bonus + PB) Nature or Investigation
Swamp/Wetland ; Jungle/Rainforest ; Temperate Forest/Conifer Forest ; Island/Archipelago
Septic saliva – {@i A noxious smell emanates from this creature’s mouth, as it contains a horrible mixture of dangerous bacteria}.
Add {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage to any attack made by this creature that involves its mouth.
Stem cell reservoir – {@i A specialised organ holds a cluster of blank cells that can rapidly redeploy, re-growing any damaged body part}.
Once per day as an action, this creature may recover up to one third of its hit points.
Bioluminescent – {@i Some part, or all, of this creature’s body glows beautifully with vibrant colours while in the dark}.
This creature emits a dim hue of light in a 15 ft. radius when in the dark.
Club-tail – {@i This creature’s tail ends in a bony mass that it can use to bash targets}.

entries: As a bonus action, this creature may make one melee attack with the profile:
{@b Club-tail}. Melee Weapon Attack: range, 5 ft., +(Strength bonus + PB) to hit, one target. Hit: 1d6 + PB bludgeoning damage.

rows: Gastric barrier – {@i This creature has a specialised digestive system that makes it particularly hardy}.
This creature has advantage on Constitution saving throws.
Ink sacs – {@i By squeezing specialised sacs on this creature’s neck, it can spray ink from its mouth}.
As a bonus action, this creature may squirt ink at an opponent. Select a creature within 20 ft. It must succeed a DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB) Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for two rounds.
Nocturnal – {@i This creature naturally prefers the dark and has very large eyes}.
This creature gains dark vision equal to its normal vision, or increases its dark vision range by 30 ft. It is generally only active at night.
Telepathic cortex – {@i A large bump at the back of this creature’s skull houses an extra brain cortex}.
This creature is able to telepathically communicate with any other members of its species within 200 ft.
Opposable claws – {@i One claw on each hand is bent inwards, forming a thumb}.
This creature may interact with objects that require simple or complex movements, such as opening a door or using a trinket.
Interlocking scales – {@i Thick, tightly locked scales coat this creature’s body}.
This creature gains resistance to piercing damage.
Horned – {@i Fused scales protrude from this creature’s forehead or snout, forming pointed horns}.

If this creature moves at least 20 ft. towards a creature, it can use its bonus action to make a horn attack. If that creature is within 5 ft., it must succeed a DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB) Dexterity save or take 1d6 + PB piercing damage.
Fusiform – {@i This creature can tuck its arms and legs to its sides and adopt a fish-like shape}.
If this creature can swim, double its swim speed.
Enhanced hepatocytes – {@i This creature’s liver is able to filter out any poisons almost instantly}.
This creature is immune to the poisoned condition.
Quick-witted – {@i This creature can react quickly to changing situations}.
This creature has advantage on Intelligence saving throws.
Elongated snout – {@i The snout and nose of this creature is  extended, giving it a much more powerful sense of smell}.
This creature has advantage on Perception checks that involve smell.
Dermal spines – {@i Thick scales protrude from this creature, giving its body a spikey appearance}.
When hit by a melee attack, this creature can use its reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} + PB piercing damage to the attacking creature.
Gelatinous saliva – {@i Thick globules of slimy saliva drip from this creature’s mouth}.
Attacks from this creature that involve its mouth reduce a hit creature’s movement speed by 10 ft. (to a minimum of 5 ft., non-cumulative).
Tonic immobility – {@i This creature can feign death, falling on its back with its belly up and tongue hanging out}.

If this creature would be reduced to 0 hit points, it is instead reduced to 1. It feigns death, appearing dead unless it is inspected with a DC (8 + Wisdom bonus + PB) Investigation or Nature check (their choice). It may choose to exit this feign at any point.
Fearsome roar – {@i Powerful lungs allow this creature to let out a gaudy and terrifying roar}.

As an action, this creature can roar. Each other creature within 30 ft. must succeed a DC (8 + Charisma bonus + PB) Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of this creature for 1 minute. They may repeat this save at the end of their turn and on a successful save are immune to the effect for 24 hours.
Automimicry – {@i Strange patterns and growths make it difficult to determine where this creature’s head is}.
If this creature would be critically hit, the attack is instead resolved as a normal hit.
Sciurus tail – {@i This creature has a large fluffy tail that it can flick rapidly}.
This creature is unaffected by temperatures as low as -20°C Celsius (-4°F Fahrenheit) and can communicate silently with any other creatures of the same species that can see it.
Serrated denticles – {@i The claws or teeth of this creature are jagged and saw-like}.
All melee attacks this creature makes deal an additional {@dice 1d4} slashing damage.
Hereditary memory – {@i Ancestral memories are  encoded into this creature's DNA}.
This creature has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
Antlered – {@i Multi-pronged antlers protrude from this creature’s skull. It can swing them back and forth, slashing at foes.}

If this creature moves at least 20 ft. towards a creature, it can use its bonus action to make an antler attack. If that creature is within 5 ft., it must succeed a DC (8 + Dexterity bonus + PB) Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 + PB slashing damage
Pneumatisation – {@i This creature has air sacs and chambers within its bones, making it much lighter}.
Half this creature’s weight and increase its walking speed by 10 ft.
Mana-infused cortex – {@i A pale-blue glow around this creature’s head reveals it has innate magical abilities}.
Select one cantrip of your choice. This creature knows that cantrip. Its spell save DC is (8 + Wisdom Bonus + PB) and spell attack modifier is (Wisdom bonus + PB).
Bombardier gland – {@i Bulbous sacs on this creature’s body allow it to spit or secrete reactive chemicals that ignite when they mix}.
Add {@dice 1d4} fire damage to any attack made by this creature.
Thin dermis – {@i The skin of this creature is sickly thin and its veins are visible below the surface}.
This creature is vulnerable to piercing damage. Instead of increasing its CR with this mutation, decrease it.
Waxy skin – {@i This creature has a thick waxy coating on its skin}.
This creature is unaffected by temperatures as high as 40°C Celsius (104°F Fahrenheit). Reduce any slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage this creature takes by 2.
Viperism – {@i A soft tissue frill can extend from this creature’s neck, and it can spit like a viper}.

entries: As a bonus action, this creature may make one attack with the profile:
Venom Spit. Ranged Weapon Attack: range, 30 ft., +(Dexterity bonus + PB) to hit, one target. Hit: 1d6 + PB acid damage.

rows: Finned tail – {@i This creature has a large fleshy fin on the end of its tail}.
While in water, this creature has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and can dash as a bonus action.
Beaked – {@i A keratinous beak sheathes this creature’s snout, concealing its mouth below}.
This creature may add {@dice 1d6} piercing damage to any attack that involves its mouth.
Bony frill – {@i A broad bony frill projects from the back of this creature’s head, allowing it to shield its body from attacks}.
Increase the AC of this creature by 2.
Strong swimmer – {@i This creature has powerful limbs and broad claws/paws/hands that aid it in moving through water}.
This creature gains a swim speed equal to 75% of its walking speed (rounded up to the nearest 5 ft.)
Augmentative size – {@i This creature is much larger than you would expect}.
Increase this creature’s size by one stage, and its attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage (of the same damage type that they normally deal), but -2 from any Dexterity saving throws.
Hyper-bioluminescence – {@i Rather than glowing dimly, for a moment this creature can flash an extremely bright bioluminescent light}.

Once per day as an action, this creature may produce a flash of bright light. All other creatures within 20 ft. that can see it must succeed a DC (8 + Constitution bonus + PB) Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 2 rounds.
Complex inner-ear – When other creatures would fall over, this creature is able to stagger and stabilise itself}.
This creature cannot be knocked prone.
Thick plumage – Particularly dense and thick feathers or fur cover this creature, giving it a puffy appearance}.
This creature gains resistance to cold damage.
Xerophytic – {@i Specialised fleshy flaps cover this creature’s nostrils, and it has waxy skin or scales}.
This creature can survive without water for up to one week.
Excessive myelin – {@i This creature has a reinforced nervous system}.
This creature is immune to the paralyzed condition.
Frail – {@i This creature appears thin and brittle}.
This creature has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Instead of increasing its CR with this mutation, decrease it.
Venomous – {@i Horrible green venom seeps from grooves in this creature’s claws and teeth}.
Add {@dice 1d4} poison damage to any melee attack made by this creature.
Agile – {@i This creature is slender and lean, able to move quickly on its feet}.
This creature has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
Dorsal wings – {@i A small pair of wings or wing-like flaps extend from this creature’s back}.
